falue

the user below me likes hard scifi

True!

Person below me also likes soft scifi.

False. I like my scifi medium.

User below me likes HARDCORE scifi

True!

True

False 12.

the person below me believes themselves to be irresistible to the opposite gender.

false

the user below me has planted a flag on mun

True. Although that's way too easy.

The user below me spends the majority of their time on the forums in Off-Topic and/or KSP Fan-works.

True! I party with the enigma group.

The user below me wants Morgan Freeman's voice.

False.

User below me is not an organice life form.

false ......probably

the user below me is green

False

The user below me is addicted to KSP

True.

The user below me is plotting my demise.

True, it consists of a ring of fire and sharks, you fill in the rest.

The user below me is addicted to spuds.

False.

THe user below me has done the Sepratron challenge.

False. I haven't done any challenges.

The user below me drew there avatar.

False (Nice picture though right?)

The user below me thinks I'm an eccentric guy who wants to go to space.

False. I think you're a user who is using his/her avatar to try and lead us to believe that.

Da User below me is gonna be all up in dem planets, Bruh.

True... I think

The user below me is the same person who's above me

False. I am below you.

The user below me knows when I am not am makeing joke now.

Kinda...

The next user is 8+ hours ahead of me. (If you live from the left of the Prime Meridian to the International Dateline, you are living 8+ hours ahead of me. Otherwise, you are living 4.5 hours behind me to 7.5 hours ahead of me.)

*yawn* maybe, maybe not. too tired to do the math, and don't wanna sleep.

The user below me is in the eastern hemisphere.

False. I'm at the bottem of the world. I'm in no hemisphere and every hemisphere at the same time.

The user below me hase flown an airplane.

True. If you mean "rode an airplane" also:

The user below me agrees with this.

False. Riding an airplane applies to flight attendants (I think), passengers, and co-pilots who aren't piloting. Flying an airplane applies to pilots and co-pilots who flew.

The next user is unsure.
